GameObjects

Class MovableBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameObjects.GameObject
      • GameObjects.MovableBox
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VisibleObject

    public class MovableBox
extends GameObject
implements VisibleObject
    Moveable Box is a class that handles a cube-shaped maze object which can move through the level.
    Author:
    Tom Hogervorst

      MovableBox(javax.vecmath.Vector3d pos, float squareSize, float height)
      Creates a new movable box of the given size on the given location.

      • setActivationTile

        public void setActivationTile(int x,
                     float y,
                     int z,
                     int move_once)
        Sets the activation tile of this box. When the player touches this tile, the box starts moving.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of the new activation tile.
        y - y coordinate of the new activation tile.
        z - z coordinate of the new activation tile.

      • display

        public void display(javax.media.opengl.GL gl)
        Description copied from interface: VisibleObject
        display(GL) contains all the GL callback functions to display the object on the screen.

        The OpenGL functions can be accessed through the GL context, for example:

        • gl.glBegin( GL.GL_QUADS );
        • gl.glVertex3d( 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 );
        • gl.glEnd();
        Note that both the functions as the GL static variables are called through gl. Because the static variables should be called in a static way, we type GL in caps then, like GL.GL_QUADS.
        Specified by:
        display in interface VisibleObject
        Parameters:
        gl - the GL context in which will be drawn
